Just a list of some non-fiction books I’ve read or am reading and a list of stuff to remind me to read :)

I’ll updated this list now and then … might even include fiction books later on.

read/reading:

  • Henrik Kniberg - Lean from the Trenches: Managing Large-Scale Projects with Kanban
  • Sam Newman - Building Microservices
  • Nir Eyal - Hooked: How to Build Habit-Forming Products
  • Clayton Christenson - The Innovator’s Solution: Creating and Sustaining Successful Growth
  • George Fairbanks - Just Enough Software Architecture: A Risk-Driven Approach
  • Jez Humble - Continuous Delivery: Reliable Software Releases through Build, Test, and Deployment Automation
  • Eric Evans - Domain Driven Design
  • Kent Beck - Test Driven Development
  • Jason Freid - Rework
  • Leonard Mlodinow - The Drunkard’s Walk: How Randomness Rules Our Lives

… more to come

future reading:

  • Mary Lynn Manns - Fearless Change: Patterns for Introducing New Ideas
  • Russell Ackoff - Re-Creating the Corporation: A Design of Organizations for the 21st Century
  • Jeff Patton - User Story Mapping: Discover the Whole Story, Build the Right Product
  • Gojko Adzic - Fifty Quick Ideas To Improve Your User Stories
  • Tom Demarko - Slack: Getting Past Burnout, Busywork, and the Myth of Total Efficiency
